cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 360 miles SSE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest, forecast to bend northwest and slow, reaching the middle Texas coast then stalling near the coast through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Port O'Connor/Matagorda Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch south of Port Mansfield to the Mouth of the Rio Grande and north of San Luis Pass to High Island
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Port Mansfield to Matagorda Texas; Storm Surge Warning from Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward past Matagorda Bay to High Island
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane conditions likely late Friday into Saturday with sustained winds potentially 90–110 mph and higher gusts near landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge 6–10 ft possible in and near Matagorda Bay and Port O’Connor, causing significant coastal inundation.
weather_observation.rainfall: 12–20 inches with isolated 30 inches possible, producing life-threatening freshwater flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Prolonged period of high waves, strong rip currents, and potential river flooding will disrupt port operations for several days.
